info.title: Nua.ge API
info.description:
Welcome on this Nua.ge API documentation!

# Disclaimer
Our product is brand new (launched in november 2021). 
Even if we try hard not to break everything, we allow ourself to make some backward-incompatible changes in this API until **June 30th 2022**.

All breaking changes modifications will be reported in the [API Changelog doc](https://docs.nua.ge/fr/article/changelog-api-pnrjt4/).


# Direct links to specifications

* OpenAPI v3 spec file: https://api.nua.ge/docs/openapi.json
* (BETA) Hydra+LD spec file https://api.nua.ge/docs/openapi.jsonld

# Open-sourced connectors
* **(OFFICIAL)** SDK-JS *(To be published in january 2022)*
* Developped by Nua.ge users (no support provided): 
  * Terraform provider : https://github.com/MKCG/terraform-provider-nuage
  * Typescript library : https://github.com/Jazys/nuag.e-lib

# Finding help

We recommend you start your crash course by reading [a few tutorials we wrote here](https://docs.nua.ge).

We will soon launch a "nuage" tag on Stackoverflow for you to post questions about our API usage.

token.example: a JWT token that can be read on jwt.io

get.description: Retrieve pending invitations on current organization.

GetInvitationItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/invitations/{id}`.

post.description: Invite a new user on your organization

get.description: Retrieves an Invitation resource.

GetInvitationItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/invitations/{id}`.

get.description: Retrieve key pairs for the current user.

GetKeypairItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/keypairs/{id}`.

post.description: Add a public key, that will be associated to the current user.

get.description: get a specific key

GetKeypairItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/keypairs/{id}`.

get.description: There is a limit on how many users and projects you can have. This will return what the limits are.
This call should not be used, as it has little interest. It will be removed in a future version.

get.summary: Get a valid Mercure auth token.
get.description: This token should be provided to all Mercure calls. It is valid for one hour.

post.summary: Register an email to the Plezi newsletter.
post.description: Register an email to the Plezi newsletter with optional fields (firstName, lastName, company).

patch.summary: Edit a contact information in Plezi.
patch.description: Use invitationId as ID here. This invitation contains the email we use for the update.

get.description: As this call is scoped to your account, you should get only one record.
Used by our webinterface to see if nua.ge subdomain is used

GetPasswordItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/passwords/{id}`.

post.description: creates a request to reset password. This will send an email to the given user. This API call is rate-limited.

get.description: Retrieves a given user password request to finish it.

GetPasswordItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/passwords/{id}`.

GetProjectItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/projects/{id}`.

delete.description: Project must be empty before deletion

GetProjectItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/projects/{id}`.

patch.description: Only description can be edited at that time

post.summary: Get a new token with refresh token.
post.description: The resulted token is valid for one hour and refreshtoken used for this call is deleted. The new provided refresh token must be used for the next call. A refreshtoken is valid for one month.

get.description: Roles are security grants accorded to each user.

Sponsorship is a way for a user to invite people to use nua.ge. This call is about getting a sponsorship code to know what's the name of the inviter and how much credit it will give to the invited if he provides its credit card

get.summary: List all users on the current organization.
Retrieve a specific user on the current organization.

delete.summary: Delete a user from an organization.

GetUserItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /arya/users/{id}`.

patch.summary: Edit a user to an organization.
patch.description: You can always edit yourself. You can edit some attributes on other users if you are an admin

get.description: An item is a generic entity describing anything that can be sold: flavors, images ...

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Product is just an item, with price.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

post.description:
This is a unique endpoints to get all the metrics you want about your usage, let it be cores, memory ... or money.
 *                  This endpoint tries to follow standard Simpod/Json, so that it may be easy, in a future version, to plug it directly into Grafana

get.description: Flavors details a specific hardware configuration: cores, memory and base storage. You may get different results whether you are logged or not because custom flavors can be returned per organization.
Images represents operating system originally installed in your VM. You may get more results if logged because custom images will be returned.
List IP associated to your servers

GetIpItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /rockefeller/ips/{id}`.

delete.description: You can only delete public IPs.

GetIpItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /rockefeller/ips/{id}`.

get.description: Security groups represents a group of firewall rules, that can be applied to a server
We recommand you use SecurityGroup entity instead, that will return security rules aggregated.
We recommand you use SecurityGroup entity instead, that will return security rules aggregated.
This is the list of your servers, or instances, or VM (whatever you called them).

GetServerItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /rockefeller/servers/{id}`.
The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /rockefeller/servers/{id}`.

patch.description: So far, only fields description and status can be edited.

404.description: Server or Security Group does not exist

post.summary: Assign a securityGroup to a server.
post.description: Adds a security group (firewall rules) to a specific server. These rules will be applied to all PUBLIC interfaces.

404.description: Server or Security Group does not exist

delete.summary: Unassign a securityGroup from a server.
delete.description: Removes a security group from a specific server.

get.description: Retrieve all contracts, signed or not, visible to your organization.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Retrieve a specific contract.
Allows to check if a specific coupon exists and has not been used before. This call is rate-limited
As there is only one customer per org, you should get only one record.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

post.description: Allows an admin user to sign a new contract.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

post.description: Try to capture the money of an invoice and update the linked billing period if available.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of items per page

delete.description: You cannot delete the default PM (or the last one)

get.description: Sponsorship logs is the history of sponsorships on your organization. It allows you to see if you sponsored user, and when will you get the money $$$

Project ID (See entity Project). We don't type hint because the output DTO
returns a string for getProject().

via its server).

Customer-Read.description:
Customer entity
NOTE: to validate subentities, to not forget to add "Valid" constraint.

state.description: Customer state represents a summary of its payment methods.

email.description:
Default email associated to this customer. Any issue with invoicing will
be sent to this email.

name.description: Company name. Used on invoices.

balance.description: Customer balance. If negative, it means customer has a credit (like a coupon).

vatRate.description: vatRate is forced to 20% because we do not handle different VAT rates so far.
